name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspect for damage and wear, Confirm items are correct size as per drawings and Specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be DN150 SN16 PVC-U rubber ring jointed
○ Items are approved as per contract specification
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Set out completed by an approved surveyor marked allignment
Acceptance Criteria - Allignment set out matches drawings or aggreed by the Engineer
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - excavate to achieve required depth to invert as per drawings
○ Floor of trench to be even across width and length
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Trench Floor Foundation to be checked it is suitable to support loads
Acceptance Criteria - Foundation should avoid very soft clay, saturated soil, or fragmented rock
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipe installed to grade as per design drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe not damaged during installation
○ Pipe installed to grade within tolerances
Verifying Document - Photos, Grade check sheet, Survey of position for as-built
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Lateral connection as per drawing
Acceptance Criteria - Lateral connection as per drawing and DCC standard details
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Embedment material AP20 or approved by the Engineer in writing
○ Where required (trenches with >5% slope) AP20 stabilised with cement hall be used (40kg cement to 1000kg aggregate)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Backfill in 200mm layers of compacted material
○ Compaction testing one test every two layers as required
○ Conductive signal strip to be laid at 300mm above pipe
Acceptance Criteria - 95% MDD in roads, paths, and pavements
Verifying Document - Photos, Compaction test results
Frequency - During Installation, compaction testing per 50m of pipeline or per straight section of pipeline
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On Site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - 200mm compacted layer of M440
Verifying Document - Photos, Compaction test results
Frequency - During Installation, compaction testing per 50m of pipeline or per straight section of pipeline
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On Site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Completed pipelines including laterals to be tested in the presence of the Engineer or their Representative in accordance with AS/NZS 2566.2 Section 6.4
Frequency - Every section of pipe completed
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - CCTV inspection to confirm pipeline conforms with specification
Acceptance Criteria - Pipeline will fail is any of the following is visible:
○ Pipe misalignment or deformation more than 5% of the pipe diameter
○ Dips or ponding of water inside the pipe
○ Defects such as open joints, potruding laterals, cracked barrels, or similar
Verifying Document - Test Records, CCTV footage
Frequency - Every section of pipe completed

Acceptance Criteria - Items are approved as per contract specification

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Manholes to be water tested up to within 150mm of the concrete lid level.
Acceptance Criteria - The amount of water leakage from chamber under test shall not exceed 1/300 of the volume of the chamber during a 30 minute period

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - PE pipelines to be tested in accordance with specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Specification Attachment C, clause 4.7.5
○ No Thrust block failures, No visible leaks, Do not exceed make-up water limit
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Disinfection to be completed in accordance with specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Specification Attachment C, clause 4.12
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspect for damage and wear, Confirm items are correct as per drawings and specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be DN315 PE100 PN20
○ Material and fittings are approved as per contract specification
Verifying Document - Photo of pipe bundle(s) showing pipe classification.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Confirming just one butt welding machine in use during life of project.
Acceptance Criteria - Accepted by Client as suitable for use
Verifying Document - Current calibration certificate/service record
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Competency certificate of welder and certificate of fitness for welding equipment
Acceptance Criteria - Testing of weld samples carried out by an IANZ accredited laboratory.
Verifying Document - Current welding certificates of operatives
○ Current calibration record of welding Equipment
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - one pre-qualification per operator, one pilot weld per machine/per DN.
○ Test failures will require the previous weld and the following weld to be tested and passed.
Verifying Document - Tensile test results from Kiwi Mechanical Ltd
Frequency - Every 50 welds per operator (or as requested by Client).
○ Test frequency to be reduced in response to consistent pass results, with Engineers approval.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Weld completed to required standard and specification
Verifying Document - Power App or manual records
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Check, Dimension Inspection
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Ensure QA package complete.
Acceptance Criteria - all necessary documents including HDPE welding compiled and handed over to ER in completeness.
Verifying Document - Excel spreadsheet exported from Power App, includes weld photos and weld date from weld equipment.
○ EF controller printout for all EF joints
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Inspection, Monitor on Random Basis
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Each pipe welding location check pipes to be welded
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be DN315 PE100 PN20
○ EF fittings correct size, SDR, PE100 and pressure rating.
Verifying Document - Photo of markings and labels on pipe.

Acceptance Criteria - Accepted by Client as suitable for use
Verifying Document - Current calibration certificate/service record
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Competency certificate of welder and certificate of fitness for welding equipment
○ Generator capacity adequate for the EF fittings.
Acceptance Criteria - Have peel decohesion test of weld samples carried out by an IANZ accredited laboratory.
Verifying Document - Current welding certificates of operatives
○ Current calibration record of welding Equipment
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - one pre-qualification per operator, one pilot weld per machine/per DN.
Verifying Document - Peel decohesion test results from Kiwi Mechanical Ltd
Frequency - Every 20 welds per operator (or as requested by Client).
○ Test frequency to be reduced in response to consistent pass results, with Engineers approval.

○ Only move strings after EF’s have cooled!
○ EF controller printout for all EF joints
